intro: Comandra californica, commonly known as the California comandra, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral environments. Comandra californica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
